title: Study: Surge In Okla. Quakes Can Be Traced To Drilling Operations
teaser: StateImpact Oklahoma's Joe Wertz reports on a new study that links a "swarm" of earthquakes to four specific, high-volume oil and gas industry disposal wells. It's one of several reports that show oil and gas activity could be causing a rise in earthquake activity.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
